text: http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/league/{league_key} sub-resource league extracted using URI like: http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/league/{league_key}/{sub_resource} Multiple sub-resources can extracted league URI using format like: http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/league/{league_key};={sub_resource_1},{sub_resource_2}

title: Yahoo_API_Guide
text: Default sub-resource: metadata
code: #>           Name #> 1     metadata #> 2     settings #> 3    standings #> 4   scoreboard #> 5        teams #> 6      players #> 7 draftresults #> 8 transactions #>                                                                                                                                 Description #> 1                                          Includes league key, id, name, url, draft status, number of teams, and current week information. #> 2                      League settings. For instance, draft type, scoring type, roster positions, stat categories and modifiers, divisions. #> 3        Ranking of teams within the league. Accepts Teams as a sub-resource, and includes team_standings data by default beneath the teams #> 4 League scoreboard. Accepts Matchups as a sub-resource, which in turn accept Teams as a sub-resource. Includes team_stats data by default. #> 5                                                                                                                  All teams in the league. #> 6 trades. #>                                                                                                    URI #> 1 title: Yahoo_API_Guide
text: Default sub-resource: metadata
code: #>           Name #> 1     metadata #> 2        stats #> 3    standings #> 4       roster #> 5 draftresults #> 6     matchups #>                                                                                           Description #> 1                 Includes team key, id, name, url, division ID, logos, and team manager information. #> 2                                                                   Team statistical data and points. #> 3   Team rank, wins, losses, ties, and winning percentage (as well as divisional data if applicable). #> 4 Team roster. Accepts a week parameter. Also accepts Players as a sub-resource (included by default) #> 5                                                                List of players drafted by the team. #> 6                                         All the matchups this team has scheduled (for H2H leagues). #>                                                                                                                                                                                        URI #> 1                                                                                                                                                     /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/metadata #> 2 Season stats: /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/stats Week stats: /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/stats;type=week;week={week} Note: {week} is a non-zero integer, or current for the current week. #> 3                                                                                                                                                    /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/standings #> 4         Roster for a particular week: /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/roster;week={week} Note {week} is a non-zero integer. If week is current, or isn't provided, defaults to current week. #> 5                                                                                                                                                 /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/draftresults #> 6                                                                    All matchups: /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/matchups Particular weeks: /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/matchups;weeks=1,3,6 #>                                                                                                                      Sample #> 1                                                          http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/223.l.431.t.9 #> 2                                   http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/223.l.431.t.9/stats;type=week;week=2 #> 3                                                http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/223.l.431.t.9/standings #> 4 http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/411.l.431.t.9/roster;week=2 - The week 2 roster for team 223.l.431.t.9 #> 5                                             http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/223.l.431.t.9/draftresults #> 6                                     http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/223.l.431.t.9/matchups;weeks=1,3,6

title: Yahoo_API_Guide
text: Players team organized rosters corresponding certain weeks, NFL, certain dates, MLB, NBA, NHL. player roster assigned position ’re starting lineup, bench. can receive credit stats accumulated players starting lineup. can use API edit lineup PUTting new positions players roster. can also add/drop players roster POSTing new transactions league’s transactions collection. HTTP Operations Supported

title: Yahoo_API_Guide
text: http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/roster sub-resource roster extracted using URI like: http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/roster/{sub_resource} NFL, can specify week parameter retrieve specific week – otherwise default current roster http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/roster;week=10 MLB, NHL, NBA, can specify date parameter retrieve specific date – otherwise default today’s roster. http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/roster;date=2011-05-01

title: Yahoo_API_Guide
text: Default sub-resource: players
code: #>      Name                                      Description #> 1 players Access the players collection within the roster. #>                                          URI #> 1 /fantasy/v2/team/{team_key}/roster/players #>                                                                            Sample #> 1 http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/team/223.l.431.t.9/roster/players

title: Yahoo_API_Guide
text: Default sub-resource: N/
code: #>            Name #> 1         games #> 2 games/leagues #> 3   games/teams #>                                                                                                                                                                                        Description #> 1                                                                            Fetch the Games in which the user has played. Additionally accepts flags is_available to only return available games. #> 2 Fetch leagues that the user belongs to in one or more games. The leagues will be scoped to the user. This will throw an error if any of the specified games do not support league sub-resources. #> 3              Fetch teams owned by the user in one or more games. The teams will be scoped to the user. This will throw an error if any of the specified games do not support team sub-resources. #>                                                                             URI #> 1                                           /fantasy/v2/users;use_login=1/games #> 2 /fantasy/v2/users;use_login=1/games;game_keys={game_key1},{game_key2}/leagues #> 3   /fantasy/v2/users;use_login=1/games;game_keys={game_key1},{game_key2}/teams #>                                                                                        Sample #> 1                       http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/users;use_login=1/games #> 2 http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/users;use_login=1/games;game_keys=223/leagues #> 3   http://fantasysports.yahooapis.com/fantasy/v2/users;use_login=1/games;game_keys=223/teams

title: Retrieve Data From Yahoo! Fantasy Sports API
text: functions package can retrieve data public leagues private leagues participated current user logged Yahoo. Yahoo Fantasy API uses Oauth2.0 authentication. use functions package need client id client secret obtained registering app Yahoo Developer Network. creating token retrieving simple input data can use functions return data games, leagues teams. extensive instructions package registering app Yahoo Developer Network resources : Edward Distel’s Github Yahoo Fantasy Baseball API Reader Maëlle Salmon’s Blog deal OAuth2.0 R packages? YDN Yahoo Fanatsy Developer Website Package highlights: 18 functions get data various resource API. Notable functions include y_rosters(), y_players(), y_draft_results(), y_draft_adp(). Return data current past leagues. Functions default return tibbles option return list. Functions written using tidyverse. Function mechanics nutshell: Takes keys provided arguments generate uri. Using internal function .y_get_request() sends get request yahoo api. api returns response containts fantasy content JSON format. JSON fantasy content parsed using internal functions heavily reliant purrr package. Return tibble. Option return list includes uri, response, content api resource.
